input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Ability to swim has a direct effect on studying habit and exam score. Studying habit has a direct effect on exam score. For students who cannot swim, the probability of high exam score is 34%. For students who can swim, the probability of high exam score is 68%. Will being able to swim increase the chance of high exam score?
